intro: Nitrophila atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama nitrophila, is a rare flowering plant native to the hyperarid Atacama Desert in Chile. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is adapted to extreme arid conditions. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom during brief periods of rainfall. Its roots are specialized to absorb moisture efficiently from the soil, allowing it to survive in one of the driest environments on Earth. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
